channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Toys for Tots Campaign Underway through December 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 - Sun , December 8, 2024 (all day) - The 2024 holiday season marks the 77th anniversary of the Marine Corps Reserve Toys for Tots Program, and members of the campus community are invited to consider donating a new, unwrapped toy to join in a special nationwide celebration of this significant milestone!
item.author: Community

item.title: “Leaders in Action” Conversation with Curtis Priem ‘82 Scheduled for December 5
item.description: Date: Thursday, December 5, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa and Vice Chair of the Board of Trustees Curtis R. Priem ‘82 will discuss “the value of intellectual curiosity and mentorship through challenging questioning.” Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Arts Department to Present 2024 Graduate Arts Open Studios on December 6
item.description: KS Brewer, Alex Cohen, Natan Diacon-Furtado, Allison Leigh Holt, Nina Isabelle, DJ Rekha, Hans Tursack, and Allie E.S. Wist will address such topics as humans as processes nested within processes; death and decay; the self-affirming rhetoric of AI intellectuals; embodied algorithms; the art and science of patterns; and the DJ as a catalyst for flow. This event is free to the public and all are welcome; don’t miss this one-day showcase of doctoral student research and studio practice!
item.author: Community

item.title: Volunteers Needed for Annual Late-Night Student Breakfast
item.description: Auxiliary Services and Rensselaer Dining are looking for volunteers to help serve a late-night breakfast to students on Thursday, December 12 from 8:30PM to 10:30PM. This is a perfect time to engage with students in a fun environment! Anyone interested in participating can contact Betsy Preston or James Simmons to sign up.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum One computer down for maintenance 12/05/2024 11:00am to 3:00pm ET
item.description: IBM is installing a performance upgrade on Rensselaer’s Quantum One computer Thursday, December 5th, between 11:00am and 3:00pm. This will require a reboot of the control electronics. The update will pause the queue during the upgrade. Any existing/running jobs would be allowed to finish running before the upgrade.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Session to Highlight Single Course Enrollment Options
item.description: Date: Friday, December 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., as he reviews the online graduate programs for working professionals and provides course enrollment options to make an immediate impact on one’s work. Participants can also explore courses for developing valuable skills that benefit employee and employer alike.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: HR to Hold “Conducting Effective Stay Interviews” Professional Development Workshop
item.description:
Date: Thursday, December 12, 2024 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM - In the modern workplace, it’s not uncommon for employees to investigate other jobs and opportunities. As a leader at Rensselaer, are you “tuned in” to what motivates your staff, and do you play to their strengths? This workshop explores best practices in conducting “stay interviews” and provides program templates to assist in the creation of individual “stay plans.”
